title: Leybourne Lakes Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: David Anstiss / Entrance into Leybourne Lakes Country Park
images.caption: Entrance into Leybourne Lakes Country Park

images.title: Richard Dorrell / Leybourne Lakes Country Park
images.caption: Lake view. The lakes are developed from former gravel workings - the gravel probably used in the construction of the nearby M20 motorway. Now, they are an attractive recreational site, with fishing and watersports available, as well as providing a valuable wildlife resource.

images.title: Hywel Williams / Leybourne Lake
images.caption: Looking out over Leybourne Lake, an island with some trees can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Leybourne Castle. The ruins of the castle are located at the south western edge of the site.

images.title: Chris Whippet / Rectory Lane, Leybourne
images.caption: Rectory Lane, Leybourne. The village lies south of the lakes.

images.title: Footpath west of the Leybourne bypass by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath west of the Leybourne bypass

images.title: David Anstiss / Footpaths in Leybourne Wood
images.caption: Footpaths in Leybourne Wood. These woods are located south of the site close to the village. The woods, which are frequently used by locals for dog walking, leisurely strolls, running, mountain biking, and horseback riding, also hide a remarkable variety of wildlife.

images.title: The Ocean, Leybourne Lakes by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Ocean

description: Enjoy peaceful, waterside walking and cycling at Leybourne Lakes Country Park, near Maidstone in Kent. In the park you will find 230 acres of lakes and woodland providing a peaceful location for wildlife and birdwatching. The expansive park includes several lakes with the River Medway running along the eastern section of the park. You could extend your walk outside the park by picking up the Medway Valley Walk and heading along the riverside path. Following it south will take you into nearby Aylesford while heading north will take you past Burham Marshes to Wouldham.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a mobile cafe right next to the lake where you can pick up some refreshments after your exercise. If you fancy a pub lunch then there's the Freemasons Arms in nearby Snodland. The pub dates to 1753 and serves good quality dishes. They have an excellent outdoor area with a covered Pergola and patio area which can accommodate seating for over one hundred customers. You can find them at 267 Malling Road, Snodland, ME6 5JR. They have a large car park and are also dog friendly. Snodland is also a nice place for a stroll with its Tudor Mulberry Cottages on the High Street and an ancient church dating to the 12th century. Our walk from the train station in the town visits the Holborough Marshes Nature Reserve where you can look out for a wide variety of wildlife next to the River Medway.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The lakes are a nice place to take your dog for a walk though you are requested to keep them under control and not to allow them in the lakes.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The park is located only a few miles from Maidstone where you can try the Maidstone River Walk along the Medway. Also nearby is the attractive market town of West Malling where you can explore the lovely Manor Park Country Park which also has a pretty lake. The circular Aylesford Walk starts from the attractive village and takes you along both sides of the river. It also visits several interesting historical sites including Allington Castle, Allington Lock, the Museum of Kent Life and Aylesford Priory. For more walking ideas in the area see the Kent Walks and North Downs Walks pages.

display_address: Snodland Bypass, East Malling and Larkfield, Ham Hill, Tonbridge and Malling, Kent, England, ME6 5LB, United Kingdom
